data.title: Wordle
data.solution:
w = gets.chomp
g = gets.chomp
t = []
g.chars.each_with_index { |a,i| t << a if a == w[i] }

puts g.chars.each_with_index.map { |a,i|
  a == w[i] ? 'X' : (w.chars.include?(a) && g[0..i].count(a) <= w.count(a) - t.count(a) ? '/' : '_')
}.join
data.statement: Wordle is game where you have to guess a word [[w]]. For each guess [[g]] you are given hints if any of the used characters are included or at the right position of the word. Your task is to output these hints. For each character at the right position print {{X}}, for each character that is included but at the wrong position print {{/}}, for every other character print {{_}}. Note that if a guess contains a character more often than it occurs in the actual word, you need to ignore the redundant occurrences.
data.constraints:
[[w]] only uppercase letters
[[g]] only uppercase letters
length of [[w]] = length of [[g]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Wordle is game where you have to guess a word w. For each guess g you are given hints if any of the used characters are included or at the right position of the word. Your task is to output these hints. For each character at the right position print X, for each character that is included but at the wrong position print /, for every other character print _. Note that if a guess contains a character more often than it occurs in the actual word, you need to ignore the redundant occurrences.
Input
Line 1: The word w that needs to be guessed.
Line 2: A guess g that needs to be compared to w.
Output
Line 1: A hint H after comparing the guess with the target word.
Constraints
w only uppercase letters
g only uppercase letters
length of w = length of g
Example
Input
ACTRESS
SUCCESS
Output
__/_XXX
